articles.title: About me
articles.contents:
I grew up in New Braunfels, Texas, which is located between San Antonio and Austin. Running and hiking were the main activities I developed a passion for while growing up in the Texas Hill Country. For my B.A., I studied quantitative methods in Sociology at the University of Pennsylvania, where I fell in love with the city of Philadelphia. After completing my bachelor’s degree, I swapped coasts to move to Palo Alto for the opportunity pursue a Ph.D. at Stanford. Post-pandemic, I moved up the peninsula to San Mateo and have enjoyed hiking and running along the Bay Trail. I completed my Ph.D. in the summer of 2023 and returned to the Texas Hill Country to be closer to family while searching for my next adventure in a data science and visualization career.
Outside of my professional and educational background, my hobbies include mapping my run, hike, and bike routes; cooking vegan food; reading historical fiction; and avidly following the NBA.

            Data Science | Data Storytelling | Location
            Analytics
             Welcome to my personal website! I’m a data
            scientist and visualization specialist with a social science
            PhD from Stanford University and quantitative research
            experience in tech and non-profits.
            Data science projects get my analytical and creative
            juices flowing. I take a user-centered approach to designing
            visualizations, so that my maps, graphs, and charts not only
            represent the data, but also inspire my audience to act or
            change their point-of-view. Learn more about me and my
            functional, yet artful visualization style by exploring the
            rest of my site.
